title: Diploma in the Future of Manufacturing Business
headline: Explore the future of manufacturing as we examine emerging trends and technology in this free online course.
description: This free online course hones your understanding of the manufacturing industry. Adjusting to evolving trends can be difficult but this course breaks down emerging technologies such as additive manufacturing (3D printing). We also analyze policies and procedures that can help you consistently meet every manufacturing objective and improve your career. This course lets you predict and take advantage of changes in the world of manufacturing.
courseOutcomes: Outline the objectives of machine in...
Discuss the features of Blockchain t...
Outline the objectives of machine intelligence
Discuss the features of Blockchain technology
Outline the basis of quality assurance in AM
Outline the objectives of machine in...
Discuss the features of Blockchain t...
Outline the objectives of machine intelligence
Discuss the features of Blockchain technology
Outline the basis of quality assurance in AM
courseDescription:
This free online course begins with a discussion of machine intelligence. We lay out its objectives from different perspectives and identify its expectations in terms of modern paradigms. We then investigate the advantages and many applications of Blockchain cryptocurrency. The course then goes through the history of additive manufacturing (AM) and reviews its classifications and applications, including prototyping, tooling, and part repairs. We then examine different AM materials and the parameters that influence their properties. This includes sharp focus on the use of metal powder as an AM material, including its manufacture, process flow-chart, testing techniques and various chemical compositions. We also identify what to consider when selecting the material for AM.

We then conduct a deeper review of AM and analyze two dominant AM processes: the laser powder bed fusion and the vat polymerization process. We break down these two processes and provide detailed examples of each. The course then moves on to design for additive manufacturing (DFAM) as it applies to the system, parts and process of 3D printing. We establish the importance of DFAM with a few case studies. We then study the AM supply chain, covering its advantages, challenges, limitations and various models.

The course delves into laser powder bed fusion, a popular AM method, and examines its parameters, interactions and effects. Then follows a detailed discussion of quality in AM as we go through the requirements concerning production quality that ensure customer satisfaction. We then investigate extrusion-based AM and discuss metal powder characterization, metal injection moulding, powder properties and some challenges facing AM while presenting practical case studies from famous companies. This course sharpens your control of AM and 3D-printing technology and provides advanced capabilities and modern techniques that can drive the future of manufacturing. Sign up to sample the future before it unfolds.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this diploma course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this diploma course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison diploma is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital diploma: a downloadable diploma in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked diploma, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed diploma: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked diploma in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All diploma are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison diploma, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison diploma, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our diploma pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Additive Manufacturing Categories and Process Chain
modules.description: In this module, you will first be introduced to some manufacturing technologies such as Machine Intelligence and Blockchain. You will learn about the objective of Machine Intelligence, and some aspect of Blockchain such as the Distributed Ledger, Digital Signatures, Mining, etc. Next, you will briefly examine the categories of Additive Manufacturing after which you will elaborate on its two dominant processes.
topics: Additive Manufacturing Categories and Process Chain - Learning Outcomes
Machine Intelligence
Features of Blockchain
Additive Manufacturing Technologies and Categories
Process Chain for Additive Manufacturing of Plastics and Metals
Additive Manufacturing Categories and Process Chain - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Design and Supply Chain for Additive Manufacturing
modules.description: In this Module, an overview of Additive Manufacturing (AM) and Design for Additive Manufacturing (DFAM) will be presented. Next, You will examine the advantages of the Supply Chain for AM, the Impacts of 3D printing of the Supply Chain, Supply Chain Models, and the comparison of Traditional and Additive Manufacturing Models.
topics: Design and Supply Chain for Additive Manufacturing - Learning Outcomes
Design for Additive Manufacturing (DFAM) for Metal Printing
Supply Chain for Additive Manufacturing
Design for Laser Powder Bed Fusion (LPBF)
Design and Supply Chain for Additive Manufacturing - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: The Future of Manufacturing Business - First Assessment
modules.description: This assessment enables you to review your learning so you can determine your knowledge and understanding of chapter 1 of the course; The Future of Manufacturing Business, on Alison.com
topics: The Future of Manufacturing Business - First Assessment

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will start by examining different categories of Additive Manufacturing and example applications such as Prototyping, Tooling, and Repairs. Then, various Additive Manufacturing materials will be discussed, with emphasis placed on Metal Powder. You will learn about the manufacturing and testing technique of metal powders, as well as the process flow chart of metal powder manufacturing. Lastly, you will examine the basis of Quality in Additive Manufacturing.
topics: Additive Manufacturing Overview - Learning Outcomes
Additive Manufacturing Applications
Additive Manufacturing Materials and Metallurgy in LPBF
Additive Parameter Development
Quality in Additive Manufacturing
Additive Manufacturing Overview - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Extrusion Based AM and Metal Powder Manufacturing
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to Extrusion Based Additive Manufacturing, which is another additive manufacturing method. You will look into its methods, sectoral spread, applications, and the types of materials it uses. Then, some case studies and additive manufacturing examples are presented from notable companies in the industry. Lastly, Metal Powder Manufacturing will be discussed, providing a deeper examination of aspects like Powder Requirement, Challenges, and Powder Properties.
topics: Extrusion Based AM and Metal Powder Manufacturing - Learning Outcomes
Extrusion Additive Manufacturing for Industrial Application
Design for Laser Powder Bed Fusion (LPBF) - Case Studies
Metal Powder Manufacturing and Characterization
Extrusion Based AM and Metal Powder Manufacturing - Lesson Summary
